text: Hi All, does anyone know if it's possible to change the owner of meetings over the api?

I need your opinion and suggestion. We are currently working on a project where we are using Laravel. The client has their own database where they input information or new products. Our Laravel application enables these data to be transferred to our HubDB on the HubSpot platform and displayed on a dynamic page within our HubSpot application.
However, we want to simplify this process by creating a more efficient and straightforward API, completely removing the Laravel platform. In this case, would you recommend using Firebase or Xano? The key requirement is that the data should automatically appear in our HubDB, and any changes the client makes in their database should be immediately synchronized and reflected on our side.
Thank you in advance for your suggestion!

Our integrations team would have more detail but in these situations we usually create a syncing script on hosted on AWS and then set up a chron job for it to run every hour (or whatever frequency makes sense depending on how often the data is updated).

Quick question... Doesn't seem like the new Beta Forms editor is available as a field for custom modules. I'm assuming the best route is to just use an embed field type and then just have users copy and paste the embed code from the form tool but that feels a little clunky.

Nice, this looks cool.
My favourite speed tool right now is <https://cruxvis.withgoogle.com/#/>

I'll never understand why they reinvented the wheel here instead of updating the old form editor :sob:, they'll come up in some months with "brand new feature, you can now select new forms in the forms field!"

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
Does anyone know if there is a way to have a embedded chat widget _and_ a hidden/iframe chat window.
Our business has a need for both types of chat widgets based on the type of user/webpage being viewed.
